data.message: Dear Facebook: For Christmas, how about giving Facebook users the option of being able to make a post that won't allow comments. Sometimes we want to simply comment on something (yeah, particularly political stuff) without engaging in a long and divisive argument.

replies.message: Hi Philip. We're always listening to our Facebook community. Learn how to give feedback here: http://bit.ly/2eWeq08. -Nick
That feature -- posts that don't allow comments would make Facebook a much friendlier place to visit.

Facebook If that were true, users wouldn't have their information sold to the highest bidders....or have FB mobile trying to force messenger onto their phone, or having their settings mysteriously changed when they don't update the mobile app, or any of the other underhanded little stunts you people pull every day.

Facebook good morning, facebook! here is my now daily request for clarification on what happens to those of us who are unable to install apps on our smartphones when you discontinue the mobile messaging site. Looking forward to your response.

Facebook, some fan pages of visitors posted, can comment but can not see posted text. why？

fb, see "messenger " . That have my first questions.. Please help me
Facebook you folks are racist. You have zero respect for Greek letters   for other languages. I wrote my name in Greek letters and you sued my account yesterday without any notice
I have a page...I promot my page.but can't promot this page..
"We are always listening to our community". Lolololololololol. Riiiiiiiight.
